reviews.text: I went here while visiting Burlington and it was very cool!!! The prices are good and there's a lot to see! I'd like to recommend seeing one of the movies, I saw the coral reef one and it was really cool!! The aquarium was awesome especially because I've never seen a sturgeon before! I would totally revisit this museum again sometime!!

A great place to spend a couple of hours! We really enjoyed the starfish exhibit upstairs with the lovely lady who had great information and was really interactive with our family. The 3D experience was worth the extra couple of bucks too.

Awesome! Lots of info to learn on VT's watershed conservation, waterways, and the animals living in our environment especially aquatic life. There's native fish such as Pike, Sturgeons, and trout. Frogs, turtles, toads, and more. Tons of displays and cool kiosks for children. Overall a great place to go for a few hours and cruise through. You get a discount on admission for being a VT resident as well. Only thing is I wish Echo was a little bigger. Hard to spend a full day here due to it's smaller size but that also makes the experience more personable. Definitely worth checking out!

A fun place to visit. We are semi local and visit one time a year with the kids. Not alot changes from visit to visit but it's a quality visit none the less. Everyone has to pay for parking now and it can be tight to find a spot.

This is a great museum. They strike a perfect balance between entertaining and teaching. There are big fish tanks in there! Freshwater fish like you find in Lake Champlain. There are also play spaces for kids of all ages that are both massively fun and offer manipulation of shapes, materials and forces of nature. The augmented reality sandbox is amazing, a serious geology/hydrology tool that's also a lot of fun. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.

It has grown so much since I was young..still beautiful. Lake Champlain . The only reason it was never listed as a great lake is because u can see the other side. But,it was big enough. I was born in VT. & spent many years on & off there. Lake Champlain is a place for BBQ'S, swimming & just  escaping. Having family & or friends fun.
We always love coming down here for a walk or just to play in the field with the kids. All year they have fun stuff going on usually, kids day, fourth of July with fireworks, tons of events.
The sun is shining, a breeze is blowing, and the lake is frozen over from shore to shore. It's an amazing day on the waterfront in Burlington!

This is a great place to watch the sunset. There are lots of show's during the summer,wide variety of shops, dispensary, ferry, awesome bike path, short ride to North Beach. There is a dog park, skatepark, lots of places to sit, wheelchair accessible and lots of grass to walk on, parking,boat ramps docks, playground.

Great spot on the Lake in downtown Burlington.  Convenient to parking, docks, a waterfront walking trail, Skinny Pancake crepe shop and the Leahy museum.  More than a bit cold in the winter but usually delightful in the summer and fall.  Short walk uphill to everything in downtown Burlington, a great spot to visit.
Great place to go relax and have some fun. The offer food and select drinks. Now serving alcohol. Kinda pricey but to be expected.

RV park located just a stone's throw away from 30 mile bike path that wraps around the lake and a truly beautiful beach with post card like views. Free to walk in. Water in July was super warm. Beach sand is soft with only a few spots that show a bit of gravel. Water is quite shallow anywhere near shore making it kid friendly swimming. 3-5 Lifeguards on duty. Select food and drink available at small concessions area. Alcohol served in small but pleasant tiki patio. Just minutes to downtown Burlington with all of its charm. Many shops and restaurants to visit. This place is a hidden gem. It's not crowded. We are going to return soon!
A phenomenal landscape and well-kept place all right for all visitors in native Florence

Kayaking (rentals)  in the light waves was an experience and not that hard.   Great beach with relatively shallow for long distances.   Less than a foot for a while 5 or so feet deep at max.   Awesome picnic areas.  Clean changing and bath rooms...outdoor showers and decent snack shack.

Superb park, has everything you could want in an outdoor experience. The water does not get too warm in Vt, but you can't complain about that. Clean facilities and a nice snack bar. Bring your sand umbrella.
Fair pricing, good tasting food for people in a hurry on their lunch break or out late needing a snack. Indoor seating unlike some similar establishments. No frills and hot grills!
Awesome employees helped me find my phone. Hard to find good people like that!
Great food at a good price, quick and friendly with a fun atmosphere that fosters community among the patrons.

Hit or miss in a big way. It definitely helps to be drunk and hungry and desperate. But regardless of my state of intoxication, I've had some absolutely wonderful meals here, and some nauseously bad ones. They seem to be at their best when it's really busy. Whatever you get, add feta 😍

The staff are very friendly but the interior is fairly rundown. The decorations in the wall are great but the bathroom, floors and tables give the place a bad look. The food is ok but far from a good kabob. They don't come off of a real kabob. They are frozen and reheated on a grill. They are dry and have the same quality of a supermarket box of frozen kobobs. The redeeming quality is the sauce. It's made in house and has a good quality to it. Everything is served on paper plates, Wich is nice for eating on the go but for a sit-down  lunch with friends it would be nice to have a basket, or plate. Lastly there isn't a selection of good hot sauces to put onto the food. A walk-in kabob shop should always have some spicy good hot sauces regards.
Food was very good.  Service was great.  Wine was inexpensive.  How do you get better than that?

This would have been only a 4 star review, but the food was great. My only complaint was that they were understaffed for a Sunday afternoon, but the staff was still really pleasant. Warm and cozy sushi shop.
Spicy tuna maki rolls were waaaay too big making them difficult to eat.
Alway excellent service and exceptional quality food.
Very delicious food presented beautifully, the staffs were very polite and friendly.

Good food that will leave you feeling healthy and satisfied. It is on the pricey side but that's the price of locally collected ingredients that are always of high quality. Good options for vegetarians and those looking for a gluten free meal!

One of the only places in town to get something quick that is both healthy and filling. Also relatively affordable for downtown. Love the spriy avocado bowl, bacon apple bowl and their sweet potato fries. Download the app -- great coupons given regularly!

They messed up 3 of our 9 orders,  no chicken or wrong plate. The super grains were soooooo hard I gave up on my meal half way through. They were however pleasant. Such good potential but some clear operational issues during busy times.

Delicious - the veggie meatballs were outstanding! The only thing stopping me from rating 5/5 is that the price was a little bit more than I would have expected. Worth it maybe once or twice, but not on a regular basis.
Healthy burger! Good spot on church street! Not too expensive!

Perfect. Just the quintessential food counter. The service was excellent and the food was served quickly and put together very well. Places like this are what makes this country great. Diverse and dignified little businesses that treat everyone like family.

What a pleasant breakfast we had!  The food was everything I was looking for in a breakfast.  The pancakes were so good.  The people that were working there were so nice and friendly.  Great conversation.  I can’t say enough good things about this place to actually do it justice.  Such a nice old school feel in a too fast passed world.

This is an icon of Burlington and deservedly so.  A small diner with only counter seating, one might be dissuaded from stopping in but that would be a mistake. Certainly a local place, everyone was resolving life's decisions and catching up on gossip, but I was comfortable as if I'd lived there my entire life. Great service and exceptional menu items. Bring an appetite and prepare yourself for a wonderful experience.

It may say "Lunch", but I go for the Breakfast! The large U-shaped counter dining is a classic and there's no bad seat in the house. Earl and his family have been around forever and the local history is evident in the framed articles and photographs. Everyone feels welcome...be you a "local" or student or out-of-towner. Oh, and the food is always just the way you want it -- from the simple to the newsworthy "Big Daddy".

This is throw-down, high-five the cook kinda food in a super friendly, down-to-earth, relaxed, casual atmosphere. Food was awesome, service was great and Handy and his staff were amazing! Leave your pretensions behind and go to Handy's!

Great place with vintage diner decor and atmosphere. They know how to cook eggs and serve amazing diner coffee (even decaf). Can be a bit pricey, but it's a definite treat and one spot I hit any time I'm in Burlington.

I got corned beef hash with two eggs. Eggs cooked exactly as requested, corned beef was tender but not mush, homefries crispy but not dry. Staff was polite and attentive. Great value for some excellent diner food! Was *very* busy at 1pm on a Saturday.
The food's good. The Waitresses are nice. Portions are very good. A little on the pricey side for a diner. But I'd go there again!

This review is long overdue. I have been to Henry's for a few times and Henry's never disappoints me. It remains my first choice for breakfast because of friendly and more importantly efficient staff, wonderful homemade food particularly corned beef hash, and the old diner atmosphere. I even brought my wife's family there when they visited us from Hong Kong. Sometimes you need to wait because Henry's popular. I recommend going there before 8:15am Sunday morning to beat the crowd.
I had my first meal (lunch) at Henry's Diner. It was great in taste and all of my friends loved it. Good value for money. Appreciate their chocolate and strawberry pies.
Really good food. You can choose from their menu items or create your own salads/sandwiches. Their smoothies are amazing!
Perfect for working, meetings, lunch, coffee. Menu had a healthy slant including dietary restrictions (gf, vegan, veggie) and is all good. Interior was redone semi recently and is much improved.

Very nice large Cafe. Good selection of salads and sandwiches, but I went mainly because of reviews that mentioned it's a good place to go solo, and bring a laptop. The salad was slightly disappointing with very little bacon and no turkey, but when i reread the menu it said turkey bacon, not turkey and bacon. I'm on a keto diet so I look for meat options and this didn't do it, but my fault. The espresso was delicious, strong and bitter like I like it.

All around one of the best cafe vibes in Burlington. It's one of the only cafe spots that has a lot of space and you can get a great selection of delicious food and coffee! Great place to meet someone or study. Love love! Also their breakfast is bomb.

This is a really great restaurant with plenty of food and drink options.  I went recently and sat in the back and it is a very nice atmosphere and there is plenty of space between tables.  I like they have a bar in the back where you can work on your laptop and enjoy their fabulous food.  I have found the staff to always be very pleasant.
My latte was great. Can't comment on anything else, but it has a great Vermont vibe (said by someone that has spent 45 of their 47 years on this planet calling VT 'home')

Stumbled upon this cute little cafe one morning after a late night. I'm not from the area and just needed to grab something quick before my drive back to Plattsburgh. Their raspberry scones!!! Perfect crunchy outside, dense yet fluffy inside AND somehow the raspberries were fresh! Baking goals were set that morning.
Yummmmmm!  What a treat. Dont let the outside deceive you.
Fantastic baked goods.  One of 3 best croissants in Burlington.

Friendly staff, free wifi, good coffee and better food! The lunch sandwiches are delicious. The cafe has a great feel inside and it's a wonderful place to spend some time having a small meeting or getting work done.
Best crust ever! Super fresh ingredients. Creative menu. Excellent cocktails. Even great gluten-free options with dedicated oven & prep area. Definitely one of our favorites!

Great authentic Italian cuisine. Everything we had was exceptional. Service was excellent, food was amazing. We had an entree of meatballs and a beets salad, two different pizzas, the best tiramisu ever and a cappuccino. Really a must if you like Italian cuisine.

Service was very good and we enjoyed everything we ordered.  Food seemed fresh and well seasoned.  We shared an antipasti, salad and pizza and we were stuffed.  The colorata salad was very much on  point.  Good list of craft beer and house wine choice is acceptable.

Hands down this is the best pizza in Burlington. They also have stellar cocktails. Yes a bit pricy, but well worth it for a date night or after work drink. The specials pizza are always delicious and salads are easily shared. Haven't been disappointed with anything.

Went the first time for a Lyric Theatre Company pizza night fundraiser.  Our server Matt was fantastic and a Lyric Alum!  We shared a mushroom pizza and half artichokes on a "pizzaro?". I would have liked to try the one with artichokes and olives, but my friends didn't care for either of those ingredients.  Mista salad came after the pizza.  It was pretty busy so we didn't mind.  Plus he gave us extra to share.  Had enough to take a slice home for lunch the next day.  Excellent!  Will definitely come back to be a little more adventurous with the menu and check out the desserts.

My son and I just had the margarita pizza and the Chicken bacon ranch pizza, both, gluten free. Such incredible flavor and freshness. Love the crust and the savory toppings. I’d happily go miles out of the way for this pizza, because gluten free pizza is hard to come by and good gluten free pizza, nearly impossible!

It was great they were open so late but the pizza was not so great. At midnight the pizza was very old and kind of expensive for the quality. They charged us 15 bucks for four slices. They should just make cheese pizzas and add the toppings last so the pizza is actually fresh when u order anything but cheese. Not sure I will be back.

Poor quality of service. Waited over an hour for a pizza that ended up coming out cold and was chewy.. tasted frozen. Ask for complimentary ranch for our troubles and was turned down and was given the cold shoulder.. never getting my business again. Dominoes would’ve been better.
We just had a cheese pizza that was very good and we LOVE the garlic bread!

[Note: new name, possibly new management since review was written] 

Last 3 of 3 orders were complete failures. Done with this place, wouldn't even take a free meal. Bad food, when it comes at all, and delivery times are absurd (2+ hours) despite online delivery ordering.

1) order never arrived. Driver called 3 hours later to say they had forgotten to deliver it but were now closed.
2) order was wrong, one item missing. Delivery took nearly two hours.
3) again, delivery took nearly two hours. Driver was clearly intoxicated and forgot half the order back at the restaurant and had to make a return trip. Was the wrong item and cold when it arrived. The item that did get delivered first was so salty that it was inedible (I'm not sensitive or picky, and I'm very tolerant of crappy food)

Sandwiches are incredible. A great dining experience. Someone had told me it was the best sandwich they'd ever had, and I was skeptical. But now I think it's possible. The owner has very creative creations, and they are fantastic. I had the Argentinian Beef, it had a perfect amount of spice to it, and the bread was good to boot!

Tried this place years ago, and have never had a bad experience, it can be slow, expect 20-30 minutes to get a sandwich, but it's worth the wait. I've never had anything close the the quality here. Every sandwich is made with love, and is perfectly balanced flavor wise. If you are passing through, it's worth the detour to try it.
Good food. Great atmosphere. Hidden away a little so it seems like you have stepped out of Burlington while you are there.

Incredible sandwiches. The Lebanese Lamb and Argentinian Beef were amazing, some of the best sandwiches I’ve ever had. The place itself is pretty interesting and laid back, with plenty of eccentric decor to keep your attention while you wait for your food - arrive when it opens to minimize your wait time, since only one person works here. But he’s awesome, and his sandwiches are worth the wait.
Some of the best sandwiches I've ever had. The owner is perfectly eccentric. If you don't like warm lettuce and complex flavors this won't be for you
Super good! The turkey Italian is great... super friendly staff. Quick and tastey. Worth the money.

Sooo goood!!!!   Just walked out with a "make me something awesome" sandwich and they killed it!! 

Its been a long day, and a quality sandwich i didnt have to think about is really hitting the spot. 

Absolutely reccomend!!!!! 
Thanksss ya'lll
Small little sandwich shoppe at the top of the legendary Church Street, right next to the Burlington VT, Xmas tree. Delicious, local, and everything in between.

Super friendly staff and the food was far BEYOND what I had expected... It was by far, THE BEST, most satisfying meal that I have eaten since we first moved here to VT a year ago! (as far as dining out)
HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
Delicious sandwiches and friendly staff.  Busy place but they get you through the line quickly and your food comes out quick.  I recommend the chicken ranchero

I was happily surprised by this place. The pizzas were fresh and hearty and for a good price. I split two large pizzas with 3 friends and we had enough for everyone to get their fill. This place gets packed on the weekends, especially for dinner, so try to go on a weekday. The atmosphere is cozy and historic. Definitely a place to try at least once, although the pizza will probably get you to return again.
Excellent bar tenders. They gave us samples of all the beers we had such trouble deciding between. Excellent beer. Great atmosphere. Very tasty pizza.

Flatbread makes a great pie. No slices; only by the pie. They use lots of local ingredients and have lots of options for vegetarians as well. They have a great selection of craft beers. There are lots of great food choices in Burlington. Flatbread is a good one for pizza.

Great! They were able to accommodate 10 of us for Sunday lunch in like 10 min. We got 5 different pizzas and they were all delicious. Awesome salads too! And to top it off, great customer service and ambiance.

I was visiting Burlington because I really wanted to see it and I'm glad this is where I went for lunch!!! I ordered the "Power to the people" which was a buffalo chicken flatbread pizza!!! If not the best, it was one of the best buffalo chicken pizzas I've ever had!! If you're visiting Burlington or live there and haven't been her for some reason, check this place out!! It's prices are reasonable and the staff is great!!

Service cannot get any better.
The food was decent, the beers were excellent but the service was outstanding. 

From the moment I walked in the door I was greeted with kindness and brought smiles but the waiter that took care of us honestly was so on top of his game that I found myself excessively tipping. Well done truly well done

Cozy and courteous. The atmosphere is like a home in the woods or on a hiking trail. The beer list is excellent, filled with many Vermont and North East breweries. Every time I visit Burlington I make sure to go here. It is best for lunch as the line ups are nuts for dinner. However, if you find yourself just wanting pub food, they do have a lower level with a fire side pub and the same beer list.
Great local beer selection and delicious food. Creative apps and burgers. The kale and arugula salad is delicious. Friendly bartenders. Plus a cute outdoor beer garden during the summer!

Great beer selection and fun little places. The prices aren’t cheap but you are in downtown Burlington so there’s no surprise there. Fresh food was great with some interesting takes on classic dishes. My favorite was the “dressed greens” that were an option with my burger. Monster side salad with carrots, beets and sunflower seeds tossed in a very light vinaigrette. Yum!

Cozy and courteous - gets busy! It’s got a little pub vibe to it, if you go to the bar downstairs. The beer selection is on point - there’s a lot of craft beer to choose from in this area! Their burgers have always been delicious.
Food was very good.  Service was great.  Wine was inexpensive.  How do you get better than that?

This would have been only a 4 star review, but the food was great. My only complaint was that they were understaffed for a Sunday afternoon, but the staff was still really pleasant. Warm and cozy sushi shop.
Spicy tuna maki rolls were waaaay too big making them difficult to eat.
Alway excellent service and exceptional quality food.
Very delicious food presented beautifully, the staffs were very polite and friendly.
Food was very good.  Service was great.  Wine was inexpensive.  How do you get better than that?

This would have been only a 4 star review, but the food was great. My only complaint was that they were understaffed for a Sunday afternoon, but the staff was still really pleasant. Warm and cozy sushi shop.
Spicy tuna maki rolls were waaaay too big making them difficult to eat.
Alway excellent service and exceptional quality food.
Very delicious food presented beautifully, the staffs were very polite and friendly.

Rabbit leg & loin and a Hill Farmstead “George” to wash it down. An absolutely delicious dinner and drink. The staff were all very courteous, as was the manager. All around enjoyable dining experience. I highly recommend this establishment if you are visiting Burlington.
The food was good. Staff very friendly and attentive especially our server, Daniel. Had a very special experience.

This our second visit to Burlington-- the reason we came back? Hen of the Wood. The food, atmosphere, service, and cocktails are the best we have ever had and we needed to experience it again. Our waitress was very attentive and accommodating to my food allergies. We love the open kitchen as well as the windows into the meat rooms- you know that what your getting is fresh and tailored to your taste buds. We can't wait to make the trip back to Vermont, Burlington, and Hen of the Wood!
$1 delicious oysters. Great friendly and engaging service. Very nice Happy Hour vibes. I'll definitely be back.

One of the very best restaurants in VT. Our server was exceptional. Having an immense amount of knowledge of the menu items, she proceeded to answer question after question we threw at her, at one point describing a half dozen or so local mushrooms including where to find them, what they look and taste like. Everyone's food was fantastic and the chocolate cake was easily one of the best desserts I can remember having. It really was that good!

They're the best!  Not only are their associates extremely knowledgeable and friendly, the store is set up beautifully! I bought a bag of chocolate a couple weeks ago and was so excited to get a delicious ice cream that I forgot my chocolate! They replaced it with no questions other than what kind I wanted.
Great experience! We tried truffles, drinking chocolate, quinoa crunch bars, and watched a cool movie on chocolate making. A spot that will be appreciated by young and old!
Although there was nothing being made at the time of our visit, they still made it a great experience for us. So many samples! And so fun to learn about the process of harvesting cocoa beans.

Refined and presented with taste. You are welcomed to sample on weekends between 11-4pm of three of their newer, and more interesting bars. The texture, aroma, and desire of the the chocolate send chocolate lovers into a coma. "Lets get chocolate wasted"!
Cold day, asked for the hot a bit colder. Was great. Still sipping. Great ambeuance. Quiet, haven't taken the tour. Will though, and looking forward to it.

A cozy bistro atmosphere with excellent service and delicious food. The extensive menu features primarily non-French food, including two vegan plates (only one was listed as vegan on the menu, but their staff is knowledgeable and helpful). I highly recommend the jackfruit dish; it was well balanced, flavorful, and had a lot of texture thanks to the mix of vegetables, fruit, and seasoning.
The food is incredible. The portions are very good. But the thing that eclipses the food is the service. It was impeccable from start to finish. Great location as well.

This is an adorable Bistro in the heart of downtown Burlington. A classic restaraunt, old world charm, with an adorable outdoor seating area that enhanced it's bistro feel. The food was very good, full of flavor, with interesting items on the menu. The bistro is an fantastic location for people watching as locals stroll through downtown.
Best corned beef hash the world has ever seen.  Worth the price, great atmosphere right on Church street.
Cramped, busy...and yet...it works. The food and the atmosphere works for me. Always recommended as a plan or a accidental encounter.

The pizza is very good.  The recipe and quality of ingredients makes for the best pie in the Burlington area. I'm disappointed with nearly every other surviving pizza place around here, so Big Daddy's could possibly be the best in all of Vermont.  It's the closest equivalent to something you might find in northern New Jersey or Manhattan.  It's not conveyor belt pizza like Domino's or the one that wins the Seven Daisies award every year. It's not as thin or greasy as Port Authority pizza, so it's just right.  I wish they still had their Colchester location or that it was easier to find parking and run in for takeout at their downtown spot, though.  The 5 star rating is for the food.
I loved the pizza here. So delicious.

Undercooked, doughy, disgusting pizza. I've had nothing but gross pizza from this spot, -11/10
Should be called Big Sloppy

Sometimes their pizza is good, other times it's the worst pizza in Burlington. I gave them another chance after they went under new management and I was very disappointed.

Today was the last day I'll ever go to Big Daddy's. I ordered a 20" BBQ chicken pizza with bacon. It was very under-cooked. I figured is was a simple mistake by a new employee, so I took it back to be put back in the oven. The owner was the one who looked at the pizza and put it back in the oven. When I got the (2 times cooked) pizza back, it was still under-cooked. They weren't even busy, the place had one person sitting and eating when I arrived. The pizza broke apart while trying to grab a slice, and the dough in the 'crust' was still wet even after going in the oven a second time. Don't go here if you don't want a stomach ache.

I love Big Daddy's. I've been eating from there since they opened.  My favourites are BBQ & Buffalo chicken pizza.  And if you have the munchies,  they have the best brownies.  They are so delicious. In the summer time they open the front window and its cool to just sit,  eat,  and ppl watch.

I don't write reviews and the reason for this review is to help restaurant to improve (if they want to). I'm not Indian, so I don't know if the food that was we ordered was prepared property. I personally liked nun. But "mixed tandoori" consisted of only chicken and hamburger (maybe that what it supposed to be) Also we ordered the food to be mild, knowing that it could be very hot, but the "mild" doesn't mean no spices, including salt, at all, and this is how our food tested like. Also the time it took to cook is crazy, it was almost an hour, and I know it doesn't take one hour to bake thin bread or to cook rise, which I'm sure they didn't start cooking from the scratch after we ordered.  The prices for beer are $2 for bottle, it's very low for a beer in restaurant, it should be at least 5. Decor is also needs a huge improvement.

With an array of food options, this is a must stop for good food in Burlington.
The dining room is generally empty so there is always plenty of seating. Most of the orders I saw when visiting were to go. This is a "hidden" gem in downtown Burlington and is always a stop when I'm in town.
A full menu of Indian food.  Best was the Bhindi special and baingain bharta. The other dishes were just so, so, including the chicken tiki masala.  The waitstaff were very attentive.
This was an excellent meal! Great chai, great service and an awesome atmosphere. It hits the spot if your craving Indian flavors, they made me a vegetarian masala that was so yummy.

One of the best buffets money can buy. Try to come here on Sunday to receive the buffet food onto your plate. Remember to only use two plates. Coffee and tea are not great but they are getting better. Staff is very nice and approachable about any questions you may have. Have a good dining experience!

I'm originally from Chicago and relocated to Burlington to study at one of the local colleges. Upon my first semester in school, Red Square welcomed me to be a resident DJ at their venue - which later turned into two residencies per week. Red Square has always been there for me and helped me advance in my DJ passion and my efforts to be a professional marketer.

The Red Square environment is fun and exciting! As a DJ, I always see our guests enjoying themselves and having a memorable time. There are multiple stages in the venue that DJs and live bands perform on throughout the week. That being said, Red Square is the place to be for an array of music.
Great drinks & staff.  Always a good time!  Nothing better then a summer night having drinks on their patio and listening to music!!

I'm giving this 3 stars as bring a bit of an older couple it seemed more of a dive bar. they had live music which was fun, a lounge area and a dance and DJ area in the back. it seemed a little different than what we are used to and being a big beer drinker we stopped in for a drink. My fiance said the shock top didnt taste like normal and my ipa left a dry aftertaste in my mouth. so I'm not sure if I'd be returning. it was clean inside and friendly staff just not sure if it's a place for me.

WAY BIGGER THAN IT LOOKS! Step inside to a small dining like area and step up to the dance floor. A DJ room in the back corner and live music outside in the summer time. Only downside is the bathroom situation, (especially for gents apparently) but other than that, an awesome place to hang with friends.

What fun night life! We were in the area for a wedding and stopped in for late night drinks. The band you had was very entertaining and we ended up staying for a couple hours. Dancing, drinking, socializing...Thanks for the experience
